title: New to RL? You can start now.

texts.content: A gaming pc with gpu would be nice, but if not use:
Like to see the working code?

cards.title: Google Colab Notebooks
cards.notes: To use GPU, search how to use gpu in google colab.

cards.title: The Full Reinforcement Learning Iceberg
cards.notes: Dive into 10 levels of the RL stack with Joseph Suarez, a newly minted MIT PhD and the creator of Neural MMO + PufferLib. There's something here for beginners and world-class experts alike.

cards.title: High-quality Single-file Implementations of Deep Reinforcement Learning Algorithms
cards.notes: Deep Reinforcement Learning library that provides high-quality single-file implementation with research-friendly features. The implementation is clean and simple, yet we can scale it to run thousands of experiments using AWS Batch.

cards.title: CleanRL Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO) single file implementation
CleanRL Deep Q-Learning (DQN) single file implementation
Making Reinforcement Learning Libraries and Environments Play Nice
cards.notes: Simplifying reinforcement learning for complex game environments. Ships with fast research-grade envs that runs 1M+ step/second on a gaming PC.

cards.title: Human-level control through deep reinforcement learning
cards.notes: This paper started the deep learning revolution in reinforcement learning.

cards.title: High-Dimensional Continuous Control Using Generalized Advantage Estimation
cards.notes: GAE improves policy gradient methods by optimizing advantage estimation, balancing bias and variance.

cards.title: Proximal Policy Optimization Algorithms
cards.notes: PPO is a popular, simple, and fast RL algorithm that improves policy optimization by making small, controlled updates, balancing exploration and exploitation.
